reviewText: This video is what I would call a classic.  I've been looking for a good copy for several years and finally found one on Amazon.  It's a keeper & will be enjoyed every time we view it.  The true meaning of Christmas is portrayed here.
summary: Everyone should own this video and play it every Christmas or anytime

reviewText: Especially appreciated the telling of the Christmas story from a Native American perspective.  Shows how all men relate to God in their own way.
summary: Sensitive merging of two cultures and one God

reviewText: This movie is dated, but a classic for us at Christmas. Acting is okay, no Academy Awards, but not so bad as to ruin the plot. The plot is interesting as the story of the nativity is translated into a Native American concept.  We like and view it every year.

reviewText: I really enjoyed "Miracle in the Wilderness." It was a well acted, most beautiful and touching story of one pioneer women's faith and how her telling of the story of  of the Savior's birth changed the lives of some warrior Indians. I want to watch it again next year and would highly recommend it. I really liked Kris Kristofferson's acting. The gal who played his wife also gave a great performance, as  did the calvary leader and the calvary's scout. The chief's acting was also good.

reviewText: I was glad to find this movie here.  My family saw it years ago and I had to purchase.  It's the Christmas story told in terms the Indian captors would understand by the family they'd taken prisoner.  It's the story of a Christmas miracle.
